user.title: 511 Transit API Setup
user.description:
Enter your 511.org API key to get started. You can obtain a free API key from https://511.org/open-data/token

Note: Your API key will be saved and automatically reused when you add more stops or vehicles.

monitoring_type.title: Select Monitoring Type
monitoring_type.description: Choose the type of monitoring you want to set up. You can add this integration multiple times to monitor multiple stops and vehicles.

data_description.monitoring_type: To add both stop and vehicle monitoring, complete this setup and then add the integration again.

stop_monitoring.title: Stop Monitoring Configuration
stop_monitoring.description: Configure stop monitoring to track arrival and departure times at a specific transit stop.

data_description.operator: Select the transit operator or agency (e.g., SF for Muni, BA for BART)
data_description.line_id: Optionally filter by a specific line or route

vehicle_monitoring.title: Vehicle Monitoring Configuration
vehicle_monitoring.description: Configure vehicle monitoring to track the GPS location of a specific vehicle.

data_description.operator: Select the transit operator or agency
data_description.vehicle_id: Enter the vehicle ID to track

error.auth_failed: Authentication failed. Please check your API key.
error.cannot_connect: Unable to connect to the 511 API. Please check your internet connection and try again.
error.rate_limit: API rate limit exceeded. Please wait and try again later.
error.invalid_operator: Invalid operator ID. Please select a valid transit operator.
error.invalid_stop: Invalid stop code. Please check the stop code and try again.
error.invalid_vehicle: Invalid vehicle ID. Please check the vehicle ID and try again.
error.unknown: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.

abort.already_configured: This stop or vehicle is already configured.

init.title: 511 Transit Options
init.description: Configure options for this 511 Transit integration.

data_description.scan_interval: How often to fetch new data from the API (30-300 seconds). Be mindful of the 60 requests/hour rate limit.
data_description.enabled_entities: Select which entity types to create for this stop
